column4: hmm, we probably need to fix that.  Please see my original post @ https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel-discuss/2009-May/008239.html
i.e., file a bug, but change the release number as appropriate, please [9.10 -> 10.10]
do you work with the ALSA team?
brilliant, is crimsun the username you use on the ubuntu forums?
yes, and on LP and elsewhere, generally.
please note that I do not read the forums frequently.
okay...so how exactly do I file the bug on this page?
the URL that I provided explains a bit of the background and includes instructions.
briefly, you'll run the "ubuntu-bug alsa-base" command in a Terminal/Konsole
I see, well I'll try getting in there then. I actually commented out that line in alsa-config while trying to get my laptop's sub to work
I'm currently using Karmic, does anything in Maverick fix this problem?
ah!  Well, we've done quite a bit of work in that regard, so yes, 10.10 should be better.
I'm still reluctant to upgrade, but that's mostly because I hate the purple thele :p
you aren't required to use that purple theme ;)
actually it isn't the speakers popping, it's literally a loud buzz
is it being caused by this?
